Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): support host directives for local compilation mode
Issues.Body:
At the moment local compilation breaks for host directives because the current logic relies on global static analysis. This change creates a local version by cutting the diagnostics and copying the directive identifier as it is to the generated code without attempting to statically resolve it.

Issues.Title: feat(core): expose new input API for signal-based inputs
Issues.Body:
Enables signal inputs for existing Zone based components.
This is a next step we are taking to bring signal inputs earlier to the Angular community.

The goal is to enable early access for the ecosystem to signal inputs, while we are continuing
development of full signal components as outlined in the RFC. This will allow the ecosystem
to start integrating signals more deeply, prepare for future migrations, and improves code quality
and DX for existing components (especially for OnPush).

Based on our work on full signal components, we've gathered more information and learned
new things. We've improved the API by introducing a way to intuitively declare required inputs,
as well as improved the API around initial values. We even support non-primitive initial values
as the first argument to the `input` function now.

```ts
@Directive({..})
export class MyDir {
  firstName = input<string>();            // string|undefined
  lastName = input.required<string>();    // string
  age = input(0);                         // number
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(core): expose new input API for signal-based inputs" (#53872)

Issues.Title: Allow extract-i18n to only add i18n tags that do not already exist in target translation file
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

As it is now, running extract-i18n is pretty much useless, because once it's run, any consecutive runs will overwrite the translation file entries.

This means, that once run, any new translation tokens added to the project will have to be manually added to all translation files. 

Our use case: we are adding translations to a large site, with 5-8 languages. 
The translation of the project will be a long process, and we cannot add tags to the entire project in one swift move. We have to take it step by step.

However, due to the way extract-i18n works, we cannot use it, as it will just write all i18n tokens found in the code, to the target file.

FWIW, we are using translation files with the JSON format.

### Proposed solution

Add a setting to extract-i18n (for example --no-override ) so that it will not override already existing entries for that ID.


### Alternatives considered

 A) https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge

Poorly maintained, and only supports XLIFF format.

B) write own script that picks out the translations and adds them to the current translation files (would only work with json). 

C) use other 3rd party runtime translation libraries but we don't want that - we want compile time , as it's much better imho.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow extract-i18n to only add i18n tags that do not already exist in target translation file" (#53869)

Issues.Title: SwUpdate checkForUpdate finishes too early on mobile devices
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

service-worker

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Hi community.

I want to be informed after all asset prefetching is complete by the service-worker. I'm using this to show a preloader as long as the application is still downloading assets.

In the **ngsw-config.json** I set 
```
 "installMode": "prefetch",
 "updateMode": "prefetch",
```
for all the asset files I need (round about 50 MB).

In a service (started at application startup) I'm doing something like this:
```
if (this.swUpdate.isEnabled) {
  this.swUpdate.checkForUpdate().then(() => {
    // Here I will hide the preloader

    // This will be called AFTER all asset fetching is complete on nearly every desktop browser (Chrome, Edge, Firefox).
    // But this will be called BEFORE asset fetching is complete (assets still loading) on Android (Chrome, Edge)
  });
}
```

According to the documentation of **checkForUpdate** it should wait until fetching is complete:
_Checks for an update and waits until the new version is downloaded from the server and ready for activation._

So my question: Is this a bug or do I have a wrong understanding of how that works?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): Allow mutation instead of reassignment of ngDevMode
Issues.Body:
In some bundling scenarios, there may be local references to `ngDevMode` that need to be kept in sync with the global variable. This becomes hard to impossible if the global is reassigned. This allows setting the global to an empty object instead of `true` and preserve identity during `initNgDevMode`.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

The identity of `ngDevMode` always changes when the dev mode is enabled and `initNgDevMode` is called.


## What is the new behavior?

If `ngDevMode` is set to an empty object, `initNgDevMode` adds the initial counters to that object instead of reassigning to `ngDevMode` and changing its identity. The intention is to not change the observed behavior for existing users of Angular.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: refactor(http): Deprecate `HttpClientModule` & related modules
Issues.Body:
ðŸŒ¶ðŸŒ¶ðŸŒ¶ Topic : 

This commit deprecates the `HttpClientModule` and other related http modules. Those can be replaced by provider function only.

Angular is an opinionated framework, feature guidance will help developer choose the recommended way to enable features (like Http requests here).

Note: This is NOT an indication of deprecation for NgModules. The deprecated modules only purpose was to define providers. This can be done directly by the provide function pattern.

DEPRECATION: `HttpClientModule`, `HttpClientXsrfModule` and `HttpClientJsonpModule`

Issues.Title: Url rewritten in lowercase when accessing child route without redirect
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core, router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hi everyone,

I really don't know if this is really a bug. I probably did something wrong with my routes configuration. But here is my problem:

I've got this route configuration:

```Javascript
export const routes: Routes = [    
    {
        path: "webspaces/:webSpaceName",
        title: "Web Spaces",
        children: [
            {
                path: "",
                redirectTo: "login",
                pathMatch: "full"
            },
            {
                path: 'login',
                title: 'Login',
                canActivate: [isAuthenticatedGuard],
                component: LoginComponent
            },
            {
                path: 'dashboard',
                title: 'Dashboard',
                canActivate: [isAuthenticatedGuard],
                component: DashboardComponent
            },
        ]
    },    
    //otherwise redirect to home
    { path: '**', component: HomeComponent}
];
```

As you can see I want an url structured this way : /webspaces/:webSpaceName/login or /dashboard. I used an empty child route to redirect to login component. If I type /webspaces/**WS1** everything works correctly an I'm redirected to the login component and once logged in to dashboard component without any issue. But if I try to type the url directly in the browser like so : /webspaces/**WS1**/login, the url is automatically rewritten in lowercase as /webspaces/**ws1**/login which can be problematic on my project where the parameter is case sensitive.

For context, I'm currently only on local dev environment accessing the app by localhost.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
A children url is rewritten as lowercase when accessed directly by typing it in the browser navigation bar.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

Issues.Title: Eliminate the need for change detection when observing @Output properties in child components?
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler-cli, core

### Description

Currently if we are using / "Observing" `@Output` state in child components initialized in `AfterViewInit`we have to call `cdr.detectChanges` within the parent component like this:

```
ngAfterViewInit() {
    this.onGreetingChange.emit('Hola');
    this.cdr.detectChanges();
  }
```

However it's "Odd" that we have to do this.  It seems like the child component should be capable of detecting the state change without error since the state is "Observable".

I seems like a the semantics of `EventEmitter` and `BehaviorSubject` should be roughly the same, and so we should be able to call `EventEmitter.emit("SomeState")` in the `constructor` or `OnInit` ... etc. and have that state be picked up or observed by any client of the `Observable` ...

More details here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/77782679/observing-output-event-emitters-in-child-components


### Proposed solution

It seems like we should be able to do just this:

```
ngAfterViewInit() {
    this.onGreetingChange.emit('Hola');
 }
```

### Alternatives considered

A state service like:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/@fireflysemantics/slice

Or just a simple `BehaviorSubject`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Eliminate the need for change detection when observing @Output properties in child components?" (#53849)

Issues.Title: Possibility to migrate only one component at a time using the control-flow migration
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

I want to be able to create a VSCode task that runs the migration on the file directly. But the `path` option accepts a folder path and not a single file path. 

```json
    {
      "type": "shell",
      "label": "Angular: Migrate component to new control flow",
      "command": "npx ng g @angular/core:control-flow --path ${file} --format --interactive",
    },
```

### Proposed solution

Allow the path to be a file path and migrate only that file only. 

### Alternatives considered

None.

Issues.Title: Inlining of critical CSS `ng build` optimization
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Inlining of critical CSS is one of the optimizations applied by default when running `ng build`.

The non-critical CSS should be deferred, i.e. fetched asynchronously.
Here is the Angular implementation for this:

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css" media="all" onload="this.media='all'">
```

Unfortunately, this stylesheet link will block rendering and its `onload` handler is a no-op.
I'm wondering if this is intentional or an actual bug.

The [loadCSS](https://github.com/filamentgroup/loadCSS) project recommends this code:

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css" media="print" onload="this.media='all'; this.onload=null;">
```

They also have a [blog post](https://www.filamentgroup.com/lab/load-css-simpler/) explaining the logic behind it.

### Minimal Reproduction

N/A

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
N/A
```

_No response_

Issues.Body:
### Command

config

### Description

Is it possible to implement the following feature in esbuild and in angular.json for 'Native Module Federation'?
At this moment I use Angular 17 with 'Webpack Module Federation' and I want to step over to 'Native Module Federation'.

In Angular with 'Webpack Module Federation' you have the configuration option in angular.json to define an extraWebpackConfig. Esbuild does not support such a configuration option.

I want different configuration files for different tasks (e.g. build and serve, e2e).

I want to use different configuration files for different tasks, such as: build and serve, e2e ect

Issues.Title: browser-esbuild: LOCALE_ID loses sourceLocale info in apps which use libraries that import @angular/localize
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I used `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild` as a drop in replacement for browser builder.

**Problem occured:**

LOCALE_ID in application was suddenly 'en-US' instead of configured sourceLocale 'de-AT'.
(with ng build and ng serve)


**Workaround/Fix found (maybe logical but not for a drop in replacement):**

- I modified libraries
  - **Removed all** `import '@angular/localize'` from sources (also from polyfills.ts) 
  - Added `types: ['@angular/localize' ]` to tsconfig.lib.json
 

**Findings during debugging (with ng serve though):**

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/1433929/9c0a8b13-b076-492c-a0a1-a6e7879e3f6b)
Watched value: `globalThis.$localize.locale: undefined`

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/1433929/edf958bb-6397-4fea-a766-8956a7b2884c)
At this point of time $localize.locale is correctly set to 'de-AT'.
Watched value: `globalThis.$localize.locale: 'de-AT'`

Then $localize gets overwritten because of some used library like

```
(globalThis as any).$localize = $localize;

```
(which is probably caused by an `import '@angular/localize'` statement in the lib source)

`$localize.locale` changes from `'de-AT'` to `undefined`
Watched value: `globalThis.$localize.locale: undefined`

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/1433929/113f470b-acf1-4baa-a581-741e3a5b8536)
And the angular core returns the fallback `'en-US'`


### Minimal Reproduction

Couldnot reproduce it in a monorepo, gave up.
I have my lib packages in a nexus repository manager and the app in another repo.

But even if this issue will get closed, it is a good tip that I could have needed with my search.

angular.json i18n in the app is set like this:
```
"i18n": {
        "locales": {
          "en-150": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.en-150.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/en-150/"
          },
          "it": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.it.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/it/"
          }
        },
        "sourceLocale": {
          "code": "de-AT",
          "baseHref": "/de-AT/"
        }
      },
```

Just a guess: Might also be related to https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/26350 


### Exception or Error

_No response_

Angular: 17.0.8

Issues.Title: [Severe] V17: ng-build removes part of library author code
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hi,

I'm currently making an carousel library. When running the command 'ng build' parts of my code get removed.

In my development library environnement (BUG): 

To reproduce the error:
1. Git clone https://github.com/GreenFlag31/carousel-library and npm i
2.  (optional) Run 'ng serve -o'. Everything works as expected in development (nothing has been removed).
3. Run 'ng build'
![find folder dist](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/84795623/69f145b0-9849-45f8-8cad-4bc782789e39)
Find the corresponding file in the compiled code in the dist folder and search for the method 'resetViewLeftDirection'. 'this.slidesContainer.offsetHeight;', which is necessary for forcing element reflow, has been removed.

In a existing project (BUG):
1. Git clone https://github.com/GreenFlag31/Portfolio and npm i. The library is contained in the tarball file .tgz (winrar) at root .
2. Have a look at the ngx-carousel-ease in the node_modules/fesm2022/ngx-carousel-ease.mjs.map. 'this.slidesContainer.offsetHeight;' is present.
![inside node_modules](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/84795623/2606ab3b-67b9-426b-abcc-3138681e8e0f)
3. Now run 'ng build' and find the corresponding file in the dist folder: 
![last line gone](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/84795623/faeee759-e62a-4f73-9f4e-c8e5ff11f1a4)
'this.slidesContainer.offsetHeight;' has been removed in the compiled code.

In a new project (WORKING):
1. Git clone https://github.com/GreenFlag31/lib-carousel and npm i. The library is contained in the tarball file .tgz at root .
2. Run ng build
3. Have a look at the corresponding compiled file in the dist folder. The 'this.slidesContainer.offsetHeight;' is present.

I have no idea why this is working in a new project, and not in my developement environnement nor in an existing project. I don't know if it's a regression bug. I expect it to be a configuration problem. I've tried to get the same tsconfig from the working project in not working ones, but was unable to find the problem. 

When shipped to npm, the code includes the missing lines. When running 'ng build'  this line got removed. Is this some aggressive optimisation from ng build ? If this line got removed, it is totally possible that other part of the application get removed by ng build as well.


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide default and abbreviated build target support for dev-server and extract-i18n
Issues.Body:
The `buildTarget` options for both the `dev-server` and `extract-i8n` builders now have default values that reflect the recommended and new project generated values. The defaults are as follows where `<current-project>` is the name of the project where the `dev-server` or `extract-i18n` builder target is located:
* `dev-server` --> `<current-project>:build:development`
* `extract-i18n` --> `<current-project>:build`

Additionally, abbreviated target specifiers are now supported for these options. This allows target specifiers such as `::production` which would expand to `<current-project>:build:production` for either builder. Abbreviated target specifiers are only supported for the `buildTarget` option in the `dev-server` and `extract-i18n` builders.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide default and abbreviated build target support for dev-server and extract-i18n" (#26815)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): fix mat-error not rendering with Closure Compiler
Issues.Body:
Fix Closure Compiler issue with <mat-error/>. Fix issue where <mat-error/> does not render.

Existing behavior is that _ErrorStateTracker sometimes reports error state as false when there is an error. This happens because Closure Compiler renames the _ErrorStateTracker's ErrorStateMatcher. The compiler renames all the other implementations of ErrorStateMatcher, but they have different names. Causes the matcher to be null in _ErrorStateTracker. Since ErrorStateMatcher is used as a class in some situations, Closure Compiler is not aware that it is intended to be the same type as the other implementations of ErrorStateMather.

Fix issue by declaring ErrorStateMatcher as an interface. When this commit applied, <mat-error/> will render when built with Closure Compiler.

Googlers: see [internal issue report](b/316413299)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): fix mat-error not rendering with Closure Compiler" (#28405)

Issues.Title: bug(form-field): red border-left leaking over .mdc-notched-outline__notch
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The mat input form label sometimes has a border on the left when the form field is in a error state and is empty so the label is not floating and the hover state is active.

-Image here-image uploads are blocked by corporate policy-

The border color from:
```
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__leading, 
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__notch, 
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__trailing {
	border-color: var(--mdc-outlined-text-field-error-hover-outline-color);
}
```
With a specificity of `Specificity: (0,7,0)` is taking priority over:
```
.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field .mdc-notched-outline__notch {
	border-left: 1px solid transparent;
}
```
With it's specificity of `Specificity: (0,7,0)`.

The note on the `.mdc-notched-outline__notch` class suggests this is sufficient.
https://github.com/crisbeto/material2/blob/e8b0f416cc714c1922118d7f40b706f37793fb01/src/material/form-field/_mdc-text-field-structure-overrides.scss#L162
```
// Note: class name is repeated to achieve sufficient specificity over the various MDC states.
```

But it may not be. If I add one more `.mat-mdc-form-field`, then the rule's specificity `Specificity: (0,8,0)` is sufficient to bring the style rule above the other, which solves my issue

### Reproduction

I'm having trouble recreating the issue in a stack blitz. I think it is happening due to the order of module loading or the order the scss gets compiled to css, and thus the order that the styles get placed in the DOM. When I try to set it up in a stack blitz, the order of the two rules is reversed. I'm not sure what we could be doing to make the `form-field.mjs` load before the `_form-field-theme.scss`/`_mdc-text-field-structure-overrides.scss`

### Expected Behavior

no border left on .mdc-notched-outline__notch

### Actual Behavior

Some blead through of error-border on .mdc-notched-outline__notch

### Environment

- Angular: 16.2.10
- CDK/Material: 16.2.10 (still an issue after upgrading to 17)
- Browser(s): Chrome  120.0.6099.200 (not an issue on firefox)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(form-field): red border-left leaking over .mdc-notched-outline__notch" (#28404)

Issues.Title: bug(Paginator): Form Field density is not propagated to the Page Size Select Form Field
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When a different than default (higher) Form Field and Paginator density is applied, the Select Form Field inside the Paginator that serves to select the page size remains to have the same (default) height (42px). 


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/iyuv6n?file=src%2Fexample%2Fpaginator-overview-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. open the StackBlitz link
2. check last lines of the theme.scss file where the code that is supposed to change the density of the Paginator and Form Field is applied
3. visually compare the heights of the Select Form Field inside the Paginator with the one that is outside the Paginator


### Expected Behavior

For example if `@include mat.form-field-density(-6);` is applied, the Form Fields should have 36px (without the Subscript Wrapper).

### Actual Behavior

The Select Form Field inside the Paginator has 42px height.

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.0
- CDK/Material: 17.0.4
- Browser(s): all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Paginator): Form Field density is not propagated to the Page Size Select Form Field" (#28398)

Issues.Title: bug(Tabs): ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError when providing MatTabNavPanel to tabPanel input of mat-tab-nav-bar
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Angular Material pre-MDC

### Description

mat-tab-nav-bar requires a reference to it's MatTabNavPanel via the tabPanel input. Documentation says this is optional but code makes it required as reported in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/26270.

However, when the mat-tab-nav-bar is wrapped in some other component, e.g. an AppHeaderComponent, but the MatTabNavPanel is outside this component, we need to pass the reference to the MatTabNavPanel via Input into the wrapper component like AppHeaderComponent and then use it in the template. This is the only way I can think of, but it throws a ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError (quite obvious for everyone who understand Angular's CD resolution algorithm really good, but hard to understand for everyone else), for example 

> ERROR Error: NG0100: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value for 'attr.aria-labelledby': 'mat-tab-link-4'. Current value: 'mat-tab-link-2'. Expression location: TabNavBarBasicExample component.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/udrwuw?file=src%2Fexample%2Ftab-nav-bar-basic-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open developer console in browser
2. Click around on the Nav Items
3. Observe error in developer console


### Expected Behavior

No error. I suggest simply making tabPanel optional like stated in Documentation, but of course would be nice to have a good solution to use mat-tab-nav-bar in a wrapper component

### Actual Behavior

ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError

### Environment

- Angular: 16+
- CDK/Material: 16+ aka MDC 
- Browser(s): any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Tabs): ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError when providing MatTabNavPanel to tabPanel input of mat-tab-nav-bar" (#28379)

Issues.Title: bug(MatAutocomplete): When setting `MatAutocomplete.requireSelection = true`  and using the `MatAutocomplete.displayWith` input parameter, the `MatInput`'s `FormControl.valueChanges` observable does not emit values on text input, only on value selection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the `MatAutcomplete` with the input property `requireSelection` set to `true`, everything works as expected for the simple case (filtering an array of strings).

When setting `requireSelection` to `true` while _also_ using the `MatAtocomplete.dispalyWith` input property, the `FormControl.valueChanges` observable on the `MatInput` instance only fires when an element is selected from the list. When the user types into the keyboard, the observable does not fire, thus the suggestions do not filter.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ea5mfd?file=src%2Fexample%2Fautocomplete-display-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Focus on the input in the example.
2. Start typing. You'll notice that the list does not filter, and the `pre` element below the input still has a value of null
3. Select a value from the list with the keyboard or the mouse. You'll see that the `valueChanges` trigger, and the `pre` element contains our "complex object"


### Expected Behavior

I would expect typing in the input would trigger `valueChanges` with the text that's been input, similar to how it works when the `requireSelection` property is set to false. 

Additionally, I would expect that entering a value that is not present in the list would result in no changes to the selected value, as documented by the `requireSelection` documentation, even when it's used in conjunction with `displayWith`

### Actual Behavior

When using `displayWith` in conjunction with `requireSelection`, the input `valueChanges` are only triggered by selecting a value from the list manually. Typing changes into the input _does not_ fire the observable. 

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.4
- CDK/Material: 17.0.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatAutocomplete): When setting `MatAutocomplete.requireSelection = true`  and using the `MatAutocomplete.displayWith` input parameter, the `MatInput`'s `FormControl.valueChanges` observable does not emit values on text input, only on value selection" (#28378)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-progress-spinner): stroke-width of svg circle not calculated properly for some diameter + strokeWidth values
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The `circle` element of the `mat-progress-spinner`'s SVG does not fill up to the whole space of it's container. This only occurs for some combinations of `strokeWidth` and `diameter` inputs and only if the `stokeWidth` is smaller than 10.  

E.g. for the values of `diameter=10` and `strokeWidth=5` the circle's `stroke-width` style is calculated to be `20.8333%` which is not filling up to the edge of the SVG container:    
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25979251/3b88b29a-5d6e-4cea-965f-237c41f3b03c)    


If the value of the circle's `stroke-width` is manually set to ~26%, it fits:   
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25979251/19f5cd26-8cfe-4236-88c3-30003d960ea0)




### Reproduction

[StackBlitz link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/cxwm1t?file=src%2Fexample%2Fprogress-spinner-configurable-example.html,src%2Fexample%2Fprogress-spinner-configurable-example.html)   

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use mat-progress-spinner
2. Set strokeWidth to value < 10 
3. Set diameter to e.g. 24


### Expected Behavior

The SVG's `circle` element should fill up the whole space of its container element

### Actual Behavior

The SVG's `circle` element does not fill up the whole space of its container element and leaves some space in between

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.7
- CDK/Material: 17.0.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-progress-spinner): stroke-width of svg circle not calculated properly for some diameter + strokeWidth values" (#28376)
